ygData.messageBody:
To reply to this,

I play on Rodcet Nife also and I have become good friends ingame with
Geneisus and Fentus. When fentus sent me the tell I was so pissed off.. if
it weren't for the fact that I was in Permafrost and they were in Unrest
area, I would have gone and sent some serious shouts and dueled anyone who
dared to challenge me. I seriously hope that this whole event didn't ruin
the game for them. It was always so happy for me to be able to see them
online and always helping eachother out. Trust me that makes me jealous to
see a good happy couple playing like that. (my ex wouldn't touch EQ with a
10 foot pole trust me I tried-maybe thats why hes a ex now..hhmm..)

So Boys, when you read this I want you to know that you have me to back you
up in anything that you do. But I don't want you to never ever let them mean
ass peeps take you down.. your light shall always shine in Norrath my
friends...

Your friendly Magely friend

Nate

----- Original Message -----
From: Joseph J. Normandin <josephn@...>
To: <eqmail@...>
Sent: Wednesday, September 08, 1999 11:15 PM
Subject: Harassment


> To whom it may concern:
>
> It saddens me to have to write this e-mail tonight. At approximatly
> 10:30PM, EDT, 9/8/99, my boyfriend and I were victims of anti-gay
harassment
> on Rodcet Nife. This is not the first time I have dealt with this
situation
> here on Everquest, but I was usually able to resolve the problem on a
> personal level with the person who was behaving in an
intimidating/harassing
> manner. However, that did not work in this case. I was grouped with a
> charachter named "Soorn", and my boyfriend "Genesius," we had been playing
> for about 15-20min, and then went with Soorn to meet a friend, "Odiny,"
who
> then used words such as fag, and homo to describe his friend Soorn. I
> personally sent a "/tell" to Odiny and asked him not to use such offensive
> words, as both Genesius and I were gay. That did not produce a postive
> result, but I let it drop. Sometime later I told Soorn that his friend
was
> using "bad words," and he asked me what they were. After I told him that
> fag, and homo were the "bad words" I was talking about, and that Genesius
> and I were gay, he immediatly left the group. He then sent an "/ooc" that
> indicated that Genesius and I were "real-life homos" and implied that
people
> on Everquest should be afraid of us. I calmly asked Soorn with a "/tell,"
> why he was being mean, and he simply replied by calling me a "fucking
> faggot". I am not entirely sure of the exact phrasing of these remarks
but
> I do have screenshots available, and I also used the "/report" command.
As
> a result of the public remarks made by Soorn I felt the need to publicly
> rectify the situation. I sent a brief "/ooc" that said that I was sad
that
> Soorn was being mean to Genesius and I as gay people. Soorn's remarks
began
> a cascade of similar ill-intentioned, thought not necessarily harassing,
> public remarks (which I also have in screenshots of , but may not have
been
> included in the "/report"). As I said before I have usually dealt with
> these situations on a personal level, but in this case I was not given
that
> opportunity. It was a very upsetting experience to seemingly have all of
> the poeple in the zone hate me and my boyfriend because we were gay. I
> believe that Soorn's actions were a serious violation of the terms of
> conduct in Everquest, as well as the most striking example of
heterosexism,
> homophobia, and intolernace I have seen on Everquest in the many months
that
> I have been using this service. Additionally, GM's in-game were not
> helpfull at all in this case, even though I had sent a "/report." I
expect
> a non-automated reply to this e-mail outlining your policy in this case,
as
> well as an update on the progress of any investigation.
>
> Sincerely and with saddness,
>
> -Joseph J. Normandin
> "Fentus"
> -Robert J. Bencale
> "Genesius"
>
> Rodcet Nife
